result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew T Buker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
To be paid during term of supervision.

The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Total court costs due during term of supervision.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

AODA assessment and any follow-up counseling/treatment deemed appropriate.
Absolute sobriety.
No controlled subst/prescrip medic unless prescribed.
Random testing.
Submit to DNA sample at Ozaukee County Jail.

Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Matthew T Buker in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim is not requesting $80 restitution, originally requested.  State requests $551 restitution be paid to Capital One. Counsel did not contest.

Defendant Matthew T Buker in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionaire filed. Court examines defendant.  Defendant changes plea to guilty.  Court accepts change of plea & finds defendant guilty.  Statements re restitution amounts and victim information.  Court will recall at 1:15pm.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

(JM) Recalled at 1:28pm; same appearances. State has not been able to reach victim for restitution amounts.  Counsel requests adjournment for sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant Matthew T Buker in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant files waiver, court questions defendant regarding waiver and accepts same, matter bound over.  Information filed.  Arraignment scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.,
Conditions set by court: no contact with victim

Defendant Matthew T Buker in court with attorney Nadya E Perez-Reyes.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears by video conferencing from Ozaukee County Jail.  Probable cause found.  Waive reading of felony complaint.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing on felony complaint.  Court orders adjournment, allowing time for defendant to decide whether preliminary hearing will be requested.  Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.
